snippet: Community organizations are slowly facing less resistance from government officials as they offer services to H.I.V.-infected people, many of them gay, a population that is often stigmatized.
abstract: Chinese community organizations are slowly facing less resistance from government officials as they offer services to HIV-infected people, many in the gay community, who are often stigmatized; activists hope model taking shape in Guangdong Province will be replicated nationally.
lead_paragraph: Community organizations are slowly facing less resistance from government officials as they offer services to H.I.V.-infected people, many of them gay, a population that is often stigmatized.

headline.seo: Chinese Groups Slowly Carve Out Space in Work Against H.I.V./AIDS
headline.main: In China, Grass-Roots Groups Take On H.I.V./AIDS Outreach Work
headline.print_headline: Hope in China In New Model For H.I.V. Care
